intro: Pedicularis siphonantha var. prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate monkey orchid, is a low-growing perennial herb native to alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that hug the ground. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
